There might be an easier way to do this, probably a font out there. But anyways here's what I did;
Duplicated many horizontal lines over the text and expanded the text.
Divide the two with pathfinding
now start selecting horizontally across the text and scaling randomly horizontally.
Select random horizontal lines and vertically scale them down and shift them left or right.
[Example: I cheated and used a blur at the end but I suspect the more horizontal lines you slice it by the more blurry it will look naturally. I obviously needed to use more lines.](http://i.imgur.com/uRpJOjA.jpg)
You can also tweak by selecting individual points and pulling them out.

You'll know if you're getting dry hits by taste and the actual cotton will be burned and dry. Is that happening?
You might need to use a lot less cotton, thicker juices will have trouble getting through the holes.
Another way that may help but isn't ideal is to close off/cover all airflow and take small puffs to get that juice flowing into the rba base. (Kinda like a straw)
Be warned though all these tips may cause leaks so have a paper towel nearby.
Also another issue would be that the coils you're using are getting too hot and burning through juice faster than it can rewick. Should not be a problem with adjustable wattage/voltage/temp control though.
Don't forget the AMAs on the sidebar! --

A lot of this depends on the Mod you're using.
Single coil will have a higher resistance, be better on battery life.
Dual coils, if you copy that same exact single coil and make another, will double your vapor output, create more or less heat, use more juice but give you more flavor, also have a lower resistance (1 / number of coils) so be careful and know what you're doing!

After about 15mL I give it a change, that can be from 1-3 days.
Don't forget that additive heavy juices can gunk up coils themselves as well.

At a max of 60 watts dual coils with 24 gauge will have a high ramp time.
I recommend a 7 wraps single coil build until you can scrap together a few bucks for higher gauge.
This is why I like mech mods because a single battery will get me to 100 watts easily.

kanthal is fine what gauge is it? You just wont be able to temp control i think.

Evic VT
Should be fine, the only issue is that your limited to 60w and .2 ohms
I'd stay with 26 and higher gauge wires. Going lower risks a too much ramp up time. Probably even higher if you are using Nickel Wire according to the calculator.

I actually got some off Amazon a year ago, they are some of the less commonly faked batteries.
The trick for amazon is to look at the reviews and see if people confirm that they are authentic. Then if you buy them inspect them with a known authentic.
juice me up!

Things i'd look for:
many airflow options including really tight draw to wide open 3-4 posts Big enough post holes Squared +posts that don't spin Decent juice well [+Post made of one of these metals, higher the better](http://www.metaldetectingworld.com/07_photogallery/singles/conductive_order.jpg) **Price** - if a clone, make sure it has MANY good legit reviews.
Actually in general, look for a majority of positive reviews. See the cons that people mention and if they apply to you.

Usually most of the "premium" stuff is already steeped and ready to go when you get it.
In my experience cheaper stuff like vapewild you have to steep. I'm really picky and actually wait a month, you can clearly taste the difference too.

**Black Cards:**
In her next matchmaking adventure Mabel gets ____ to kiss ____ .
Dipper's internet history consists of Redheads and _____.
Grunkle Stan's next money making scheme is dressing up waddles as ______.
A new intern has been hired at the Mystery Shack and it's actually _____ !
Mabel's new sweater design features a life like image of ______ .
The gnomes next plan is to force ______ to marry them.
**White Cards:**
Dipper in his Lamb costume
Every monster found in all the journals
Dirty Mystery Shack money
Bill Cipher in a ballroom gown
Alex Hirsch's secret stalker
Annoying Disney Executives
**These actually work with the base set as well.**

Had done this a few times before; every time they mention a game mechanic, make them pick an existing mechanic from a game they are familiar with, but ask them how it will be different.
If they're like the people i've worked with in the past they will link you a bunch of youtube clips which is really helpful.
Remember that when people think they are inventing a new game mechanic it's probably been done somewhere in the past before.
